text:
Hi everyone. I'm trying to add custom events to a heavily trafficked ecommerce site. These are events like "Added to Cart", "Download Preview", "Create Collection", and "Searched For". I'm really struggling to understand the 2,000 custom event limit, as we would likely churn through that in a week.

Are there any workarounds? Am I understanding this incorrectly? How is this feature supposed to be used?
Hey Alec - The way I understand it is that the 2,000 limits on the defined custom events, not the number of times theyâ€™re tracked.
I just asked support and they confirmed is it the number of events, not types of events.
but I guess support could also not understand the question
2k invocations per event would be un-usable for any web application
Yes, that was my thought as well. I've already been on that page, I know how to call custom events but I'm concerned about the limit.
It has to be like you're saying, 2000 would be insanely low.
Has anyone dealt with a mysterious black background appearing behind a transparent video when it is uploaded to Vidyard and embedded on the page with the HubL `{% video_player %}` ?
Does anyone have an idea for a cleaner solution for hosting an interactive map?We're using tableau at the moment as a quick fix <https://www.airspace.com/country-service-map>
Pick one: Google maps, Leaflet + OSM, react-simple-maps with topjson files, mapbox
